October 30, 1988: Fiction
THE QUEEN OF THE DAMNED, by Anne Rice. (Knopf, $18.95.) Continuing the
chronicle of 6,000 years of vampirism begun in ''Interview With the Vampire'' and
''The Vampire Lestat.''
THE CARDINAL OF THE KREMLIN, by Tom Clancy. (Putnam, $19.95.) The
C.I.A.'s Jack Ryan races to the rescue of America's highest-ranking secret agent
in the Soviet Union.
BREATHING LESSONS, by Anne Tyler. (Knopf, $18.95.) The many facets of a
28-year marriage are revealed during a drive to a friend's funeral.
ANYTHING FOR BILLY, by Larry McMurtry. (Simon & Schuster, $18.95.) The
exploits of Billy the Kid, as shared by a dime-novel writer from Philadelphia.
FINAL FLIGHT, by Stephen Coonts. (Doubleday, $18.95.) Colonel Qazi, an
''international terrorist,'' plots to steal American nuclear weapons.
TILL WE MEET AGAIN, by Judith Krantz. (Crown, $19.95.) The exploits of a
woman and her two daughters from pre-World War I Paris to present-day Los
Angeles.
ALASKA, by James A. Michener. (Random House, $22.50.) The history of the
49th state told in fictional form.
PRIME TIME, by Joan Collins. (Linden/Simon & Schuster, $19.95.) Five actresses
compete for a glamorous role in Hollywood.
KOKO, by Peter Straub. (Dutton, $19.95.) Three Vietnam veterans on the trail of a
friend who may be responsible for a series of murders.
THE SHELL SEEKERS, by Rosamunde Pilcher. (St. Martin's, $19.95.) A woman
and a painting tie together three generations of an English family.
SPOCK'S WORLD, by Diane Duane. (Pocket, $16.95.) An emergency meeting of
the planet Vulcan's ruling council exposes its secret history and that of the
Enterprise's Commander Spock.
THE BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES, by Tom Wolfe. (Farrar, Straus & Giroux,
$19.95.) A bond trader caught in the jungles of New York.
TRACKS, by Louise Erdrich. (Holt, $18.95.) The mysterious life of Fleur Pillager, a
Chippewa woman with the powers of a shaman.
THE SILENCE OF THE LAMBS, by Thomas Harris. (St. Martin's, $18.95.) A
young woman F.B.I. trainee pursues a serial killer.
LOVE IN THE TIME OF CHOLERA, by Gabriel Garcia Marquez. (Knopf, $18.95.)
October 30, 1988
Non-Fiction
A BRIEF HISTORY OF TIME, by Stephen W. Hawking. (Bantam, $18.95.) A
scientist's review of efforts to create a unified theory of the universe.
THE RAGMAN'S SON, by Kirk Douglas. (Simon & Schuster, $21.95.) The actor
recalls his life as poor immigrant's son, waiter, steel mill worker, haberdashery
salesman, film star, father and man.
THE FIRST SALUTE, by Barbara W. Tuchman. (Knopf, $22.95.) A historian's view
of the American Revolution.
THE LAST LION, by William Manchester. (Little, Brown, $24.95.) The second
volume of a biography of Winston Churchill, covering the years 1932-40.
A BRIGHT SHINING LIE, by Neil Sheehan. (Random House, $24.95.) A biography
of Lieut. Col. John Paul Vann that is also a history of American involvement in
Vietnam.
SENATORIAL PRIVILEGE, by Leo Damore. (Regnery Gateway, $19.95.) A
reporter's reassessment of the 1969 accident on Chappaquiddick Island.
LANDSLIDE, by Jane Mayer and Doyle McManus. (Houghton Mifflin, $21.95.)
Two Washington reporters on ''the unmaking of the President, 1984- 1988.''
THE BOZ, by Brian Bosworth with Rick Reilly. (Doubleday, $17.95.) The life and
controversial opinions of the Seattle Seahawks football player.
THE LIVES OF JOHN LENNON, by Albert Goldman. (Morrow, $22.95.) The rock-
and-roll star as legend and as human being.
THE DUCHESS OF WINDSOR, by Charles Higham. (McGraw-Hill, $17.95.) The
life of the woman who married King Edward VIII.
SURVIVING THE GREAT DEPRESSION OF 1990, by Ravi Batra. (Simon &
Schuster, $18.95.) What Americans and their Government should do in the face of
economic disaster.
PRESS ON! by Chuck Yeager and Charles Leerhsen. (Bantam, $17.95.) The
legendary pilot on flying, the outdoors and his West Virginia roots.
GOLDWATER, by Barry M. Goldwater with Jack Casserly. (Doubleday, $21.95.)
The memoirs of the longtime Senator from Arizona and 1964 Republican
Presidential nominee.
TRUMP, by Donald J. Trump with Tony Schwartz. (Random House, $19.95.) The
career and business style of the New York entrepreneur.
GENERATION OF SWINE, by Hunter S. Thompson. (Summit, $18.95.)
